Title: AppImage Ubuntu 17.04
Body:
Release `VidCutter-5.0.5-x64.AppImage` seg faults. Downloaded Dec 23.
5.0.0 works.

```
$ ./VidCutter-5.0.5-x64.AppImage 
gtk-update-icon-cache: symbol lookup error: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgobject-2.0.so.0: undefined symbol: g_option_group_unref
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

`Ubuntu 17.04`

Title: Please support "type 2" AppImage + support semi-automatic self-updates of `VidCutter.AppImage`
Body:
AppImages built with recent tooling from the AppImageKit projects build "type 2" AppImages. The older "type 1" version is deprecated. Type 2 AppImages have a few advantages and improvements: 1. The most important one is that they (can) include a semi-automatic update mechanism. A user can easily trigger to let the AppImage be updated to the latest version. 1. You can also (optionally) sign your packages with a GPG key. 1. (For more new features look at the documents in the Wiki.) The update mechanism will not download the *entire new AppImage*, but *only the blocks for a binary delta to the existing AppImage*. It will use the existing AppImage and the downloaded binary diff to build the new AppImage (while defaulting to the option of keep also a copy of the older version). This is faster, less work for the user and will also use less bandwidth. To see how it works, download the AppImage [Subsurface diving log](https://github.com/Subsurface-divelog/subsurface) application [created and maintained by Linus Torvalds (*that* one, yes) and Dirk Hohndel](https://github.com/Subsurface-divelog/subsurface/graphs/contributors). Download a previous version initially! You can do it [from here](https://github.com/Subsurface-divelog/subsurface/releases). Download also the respective AppImageKit tools: 
  $  wget https://github.com/Subsurface-divelog/subsurface/releases/download/continuous-fixTravisNotFailing/Subsurface-4.7.4-87-g5ca8e506b7df-x86_64.AppImage

  $  wget https://github.com/AppImage/AppImageUpdate/releases/download/continuous/appimageupdatetool-179-30cb1ce-x86_64.AppImage
  $  wget https://github.com/AppImage/AppImageUpdate/releases/download/continuous/AppImageUpdate-179-30cb1ce-x86_64.AppImage

  $  chmod +x Subsurface-4.7.4-87-g5ca8e506b7df-x86_64.AppImage
  $  chmod +x appimageupdatetool-179-30cb1ce-x86_64.AppImage
  $  chmod +x AppImageUpdate-179-30cb1ce-x86_64.AppImage
Note: *`appimageupdatetool`* is a CLI utility, where *`AppImageUpdate`* has a little GUI. Both do the same thing. Then: 
 $  ./Subsurface-4.7.4-87-g5ca8e506b7df-x86_64.AppImage --appimage-help
      AppImage options:

      --appimage-extract              Extract content from embedded filesystem image

As you can see, the user has not to remember where she fetched the initial version of her *`Subsurface`* app. This knowledge is already built into the AppImage. Results: 1. In our case it discovered that *`"50.36 of 78.53 MiB"`* date blocks for the new AppImage were identical with the existing one and it had to fetch only 28.17 MiB from the update site. 1. Also it created a new AppImage, version *`Subsurface-4.7.4-266-gd4cd4a96eae4-x86_64.AppImage`*, but did not yet make it executable -- the old version is still there: $ ls -l Subsurface-4.7.4-87-g5ca8e506b7df-x86_64.AppImage Subsurface-4.7.4-266-gd4cd4a96eae4-x86_64.AppImage -rwxr-xr-x 1 kp kp 82175672 Nov 25 01:55 Subsurface-4.7.4-87-g5ca8e506b7df-x86_64.AppImage -rw------- 1 kp kp 82339512 Dec 5 19:55 Subsurface-4.7.4-266-gd4cd4a96eae4-x86_64.AppImage You can expect the algorithm used by zsync2 to figure out the delta binaries to become even more efficient in the future, so the saving of time and bandwidth for updating will become even more cost-saving for the user. This update mechanism will also be built into the (optional) *`appimaged`* (AppImage daemon), which already is on many desktops. Users will be able to invoke a sort of *"Look for all available updates of my AppImages"*-kind of feature. For AppImages which do not support this update mechanism this will trigger warnings. I thought I better give you an early heads up, so you can avoid too many users in your neck demanding this feature for the VidCutter AppImage when everybody else has it already :-) Pretty sure here, that you can get a helping hand from the AppImageKit guys to get the tooling working, if you need this. Or drop by in the [#appimage IRC channel on Freenode](webchat.freenode.net/?channels=appimage). Also, your recent update pains with v5.0.0 -- v5.0.5 updates would have gone much smoother if you had this feature already in! ---- (If you look, the update info is sitting in the *`.zsync`*-suffixed files from the [Subsurface GitHub release page](https://github.com/Subsurface-divelog/subsurface/releases). The AppImageKit tools will automatically generate that file for you if you use "type 2").

Title: Don't lowercase full config path
Body:
Make sure all paths constructed for log/settings files have their case preserved, for users whose $HOME is mixed-case. Fixes #64 .

This is a breaking change, as it means that on Linux and macOS when `QStandardPaths.writableLocation(QStandardPaths.AppConfigLocation)` is used (as it normally should be), the user's config dir will change from e.g. (for Linux) `$HOME/.config/vidcutter/` to `$HOME/.config/VidCutter/`, and settings will need to be manually migrated. But there's really no helping that, as lowercasing the entire path is _not_ a workable option. (Also, formerly on macOS if the `QStandardPaths` path was not used, the workaround generated would've been lowercased to `$HOME/library/preferences/vidcutter/` which is very wrong.)

- libX11.so.6
- libexpat.so.1
- libp11-kit.so.0
- libusb-1.0.so.0
- libz.so.1

Title: Adding additional videos to clip index by drag & drop
Body:
As far as I can see I can only add more clips by clicking onto the "ADD" button, navigate through the (big) directory tree and add them manually.

When I want to concatenate multiple clips this becomes tedious.

I would appreciate if I could drag &drop additional videos onto the "Clip index" sub pane.

Could you add this feature?

Thank you

Title: Missing hotkeys and control to jump one Key(!) frame back and forth
Body:
Assume I load an *.mp4 video into VidCutter.

Now I want to jump 1 key frame (NOT: frame) forward (or backward).

How can I do this?

Pressing simply right arrow moves only one frame but not a to the next key frame.

Adding two more control icons between of "Play Media" and "Start Clip" with "jump back key frame" and "jump forth key frame" would be fine. 

Thank you

Title: Missing function to delete marked clip in the mid of a video
Body:
Assume I load a *.mp4 video into VidCutter.
I mark start and the end of a sub clip somewhere in the mid of the video.
Now I want to delete it and save the remaining video (as lossless as possible) into a new video file.

How can I do this?

I expected that when I press the DEL key then this operation is performed but DEL hotkey seems to be unknown.

On the other hand when I mark the just selected clip interval in the clip index on the right and select "Remove selected" then the clip still exists/is shown in the timeline afterwards.

Peter

Title: Allow timestamp to be preserved
Body:
When set of composite clips is created from the original video, it should inherit the stream creation date/timestamp from the original.

It would also be nice to have the option of translating timestamps when multiple clips are created from the original. For example, if a short clip is created starting 5 seconds into the original video, then that exported clip should have a creation timestamp exactly 5 seconds later than the original.

Title: Add timestamp in video exports
Body:
Hi,

For example, with gopro, creation time is embedded into the files metadata. So you can get it and then add timestamp (with opencv/ffmpeg) to every frame we want to export in vidcutter.

Some inspiration: https://www.theeminentcodfish.com/gopro-timestamp

Thanks
J.

Title: Proposal - accompaniment, simple transition, overlapping materials.
Body:
Will there be an option in the program to merge the background music added from the outside to cut out parts of the movie?
Currently, the program allows you to edit either a movie or background, but you can not merge it into one file, because when you enter the video file program, the video list disappears (deleted). So the sound file is the same as the movie file.

Will there ever be a simple fade-in?

Does the program will receive the possibility of imposing one material to another?

Title: Lossless editing?
Body:
This project seems to be great by it's simplicity and the set of features it has nominates it to be great platform for lossless editing. There can be some optional lossless mode checkbox, that would result in the following:

1.) Once you import first clip to project, the other clips will have to use exactly same format (resolution, codec, etc...)
2.) You will be able to cut clips only on keyframes
3.) Output format will have to match input format
4.) There will be no re-encoding during output making everythig blazing fast and absolutely lossless.
5.) As a bonus you can export to variety of containers as long as they will support the input formats

This will enable us to do fast lossless edits in cases where no advanced effects are needed. Just join few clips together and cut out the bad parts. Something you might need to do fast processing of holyday footage before uploading to youtube. Given that you filmed everything on single camera without changing codec settings.

Currently i am doing this using ffmpeg using "copy" mode and it's extremely fast. It usualy takes like 100x less time than is needed to play the video (faster than realtime). On the other hand when i am rendering/encoding the video doing advanced edits it takes much more time than is needed for the video to play (slower than realtime). But ffmpeg is commandline and having GUI for this would be super handy.

Title: AppImage does not run on older systems
Body:
Please don't use xenial ingredients for the AppImage, xenial is too new which means that the resulting AppImage will only run on very new systems. Using precise or trusty ingredients would be much better.

For more background on this, see [here](https://github.com/probonopd/AppImageKit/wiki/Creating-AppImages#creating-portable-appimages).

Title: VidCutter 3.0.0 AppImage cannot find libmpv in the usual places
Issues: BUG - VALIDATED, NOT A BUG / ALREADY FIXED
Messages: OSError: Cannot find libmpv in the usual places.
Body:
Python fails to import mpv.

```
me@host:~$ '/home/me/Downloads/VidCutter-3.0.0-linux-x64.AppImage' 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/tmp/.mount_jgstZG/usr/lib/python3.5/runpy.py", line 184, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "/tmp/.mount_jgstZG/usr/lib/python3.5/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "/tmp/.mount_jgstZG/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/vidcutter/__main__.py", line 37, in <module>
    from vidcutter.videocutter import VideoCutter
  File "/tmp/.mount_jgstZG/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/vidcutter/videocutter.py", line 40, in <module>
    import vidcutter.mpv as mpv
  File "/tmp/.mount_jgstZG/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/vidcutter/mpv.py", line 29, in <module>
    raise OSError("Cannot find libmpv in the usual places.")
OSError: Cannot find libmpv in the usual places.
```

This is the offending code:
https://github.com/ozmartian/vidcutter/blob/7ca6960638633958387bb7034cbabdd5dd9e25e9/vidcutter/mpv.py#L27

According to https://docs.python.org/3/library/ctypes.html

> On Linux, find_library() tries to run external programs (/sbin/ldconfig, gcc, objdump and ld) to find the library file. It returns the filename of the library file.
>
> Changed in version 3.6: On Linux, the value of the environment variable LD_LIBRARY_PATH is used when searching for libraries, if a library cannot be found by any other means.

Since your AppImage bundles 3.5, it ignores `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`. So this falls down for relocatable bundles like AppImages.

Can you change the Python code to load the library using a path relative to the file loading it?
